arabicText: تَكَادُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتُ يَتَفَطَّرْنَ مِنْهُ وَتَنشَقُّ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَتَخِرُّ ٱلْجِبَالُ هَدًّا
englishTranslationText:
The	 heavens	 are	 close	 to	 being	 torn	 apart	 by	 it,	 and	 the	 earth	 being	 split	 asunder,	 and	 the	
mountains	succumbing	and	falling	down.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Qarib	hai	ke	āasmān	us	se	phat	padeñ	aur	zameen	shak	ho	jāye aur	pahād	gir	jāyeñ	dheh	(mismār	
ho)	kar.

englishTranslationText: Due	to	their	ascribing	of	an	offspring	to	the	Most	Gracious.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	par	ke	unhoñ	ne	Rahmān	ke	liye aulād	batāyi		.

arabicText: وَمَا يَنۢبَغِى لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ أَن يَتَّخِذَ وَلَدًا
englishTranslationText: And	it	does	not	befit	the	Most	Gracious	to	choose	an	offspring!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Rahmān	ke	liye	lāyiq	nahiñ	ke	aulād	ikhtiyār	kare

arabicText: إِن كُلُّ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ إِلَّآ ءَاتِى ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ عَبْدًۭا
englishTranslationText: . All	those	who	are	in	the	heavens	and	the	earth	will	come	to	the	Most	Gracious	as	His	bondmen.
romanUrduTranslationText: Āsmānoñ	aur	zameen	meiñ	jitne	haiñ	sab	us	ke	Huzoor	bande	ho	kar	hāzir	hoñge	.

englishTranslationText: He	knows	their	number	and	has	counted	each	one	of	them.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak		woh	un	ka	shumār	jānta	hai	aur	un	ko	ek	ek	kar	ke	gin	rakha	hai.

englishTranslationText: And	each	one	of	them	will	come	before	Him	on	the	Day	of	Resurrection,	alone
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	un	meiñ	har	ek	Roz-e-Qayāmat	us	ke	huzoor	akela	hāzir	hoga

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ سَيَجْعَلُ لَهُمُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ وُدًّۭا
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak		woh	jo	Imān lāye	aur	achchhe	kām	
kiye	án-qarib	un	ke	liye	Rahmān	mohabbat	
kar	dega.

arabicText: فَإِنَّمَا يَسَّرْنَـٰهُ بِلِسَانِكَ لِتُبَشِّرَ بِهِ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ وَتُنذِرَ بِهِۦ قَوْمًۭا لُّدًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
. We	 have	 therefore	 made	 this	 Qur’an	 easy	
upon	 your	 tongue,	 (O	 dear	 Prophet	
Muhammad - peace	 and	 blessings	 be	 upon	
him)	for	you	 to	announce	glad	 tidings	with	
it	 to	 those	 who	 fear,	 and	 warn	 those	 who	
are	quarrelsome.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.To	 ham	 ne	 yeh	Qurān	 tumhāri	 zabān	meiñ	
yoon	 hi	 āasān	 farmāya	 ke	 tum	 us	 se	 dar	
wāloñ	 ko	 khush	 khabri	 do	 aur	 jhagdālu	
logoñ	ko	us	se	dar	sunāo.

arabicText: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّن قَرْنٍ هَلْ تُحِسُّ مِنْهُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ أَوْ تَسْمَعُ لَهُمْ رِكْزًۢا
englishTranslationText:
And	 many	 a	 generation	 We	 did	 destroy	
before	them;	do	you	see	any	one	of	them	or	
hear	their	faintest	sound?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 ham	 ne	 in	 se	 pehli	 kitni	 sangateñ	
khapāyiñ	kya	tum	un	meiñ	kisi	ko	dekhte	ho	
ya	un	ki	bhanak	sunte	ho.

englishTranslationText:
TaaHaa.*	 (O	 dear	 Prophet	 Muhammad -
peace	 and	 blessings	 be	 upon	 him)	
(*Alphabets of the Arabic language; Allah
and to whomever He reveals, know their 
precise meanings.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
TāHā.* (*Arabi zabān ke Huroof jinke 
Ma’āni Allah or Jis par Allah Ta’āla ne Inko 
Nazil Farmaya Wahi Janta hai.)

englishTranslationText:
We	 have	 not	 sent	 down	 this	 Qur’an	 upon	
you	 (O	 dear	 Prophet	 Muhammad - peace	
and	 blessings	 be	 upon	 him)	 for	 you	 to	 fall	
into	 hardship!	 (Either	 because	 he	 used	 to	
pray	 at	length	 during	 the	 night	 or	because	
he	 was	 distressed	 due	 to	 the	 disbelievers	
not	accepting	faith.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Mahboob!	Ham	ne	tum	par	yeh		qur’ān	
us	liye	na	utāra	ke	tum	mashaqqat	me	pado.

englishTranslationText: Except	as	a	reminder	for	one	who	fears.
romanUrduTranslationText: Hāñ	us	ko	nasihat	jo	dar	rakhta	ho

arabicText: تَنزِيلًۭا مِّمَّنْ خَلَقَ ٱلْأَرْضَ وَٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ ٱلْعُلَى
englishTranslationText: Sent	down	by	One	Who	created	the	earth and	the	lofty	heavens.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	kā	utāra	huwa	jis	ne	zameen	aur	ooñche	
āasmān		banāye	.

englishTranslationText: The	Most	Gracious	Who	(befitting	His	Majesty)	established	Himself	upon	the	Throne	(of	control)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	badi	mehar	(rahmat)	wāla	us	ne	'arsh	
par	istaw'ā	farmāya	jaisa		uski	shān	ke	lāyiq	
hai.

arabicText: لَهُۥ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَمَا تَحْتَ ٱلثَّرَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
To	 Him	 only	 belongs	 all	 whatever	is	in	 the	 heavens	 and	 all	 whatever	is	in	 the	 earth,	 and	 all	
whatever	is	between	them,	and	all	whatever	is	beneath	this	wet	soil.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	ka	hai	jo	kuchh	āasmānoñ	meiñ	hai	aur	jo	kuchh	zameen	meiñ	aur	jo	kuchh	in	ke	beech	meiñ	
aur	jo	kuchh	is	geeli	mitti	ke	niche	hai.

arabicText: وَإِن تَجْهَرْ بِٱلْقَوْلِ فَإِنَّهُۥ يَعْلَمُ ٱلسِّرَّ وَأَخْفَى
englishTranslationText: And	if	you	speak	aloud	- so	He	surely	knows	the	secret	and	that	which	is	more	concealed.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	tu	bāt	pukār	kar	kahe	to	woh	to	bhed	ko	jānta	hai	aur	usey		jo	us	se	bhi	ziyādah		chupa	
hai.

arabicText: ٱللَّهُ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ لَهُ ٱلْأَسْمَآءُ ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ
englishTranslationText: Allah - there	is	no	worship	except	for	Him;	His	only	are	the	best	names.
romanUrduTranslationText: Allah	ke	uske	siwa	kisi	ki	bandagi	nahiñ	usi	ke	haiñ	sab	achchhe		nām	.

englishTranslationText: And	did	the	news	of	Moosa	reach	you?
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	kuchh	tumheñ	Mūsā ki	khabar	āayi	.

arabicText: إِذْ رَءَا نَارًۭا فَقَالَ لِأَهْلِهِ ٱمْكُثُوٓا۟ إِنِّىٓ ءَانَسْتُ نَارًۭا لَّعَلِّىٓ ءَاتِيكُم مِّنْهَا بِقَبَسٍ أَوْ أَجِدُ عَلَى ٱلنَّارِ هُدًۭى
englishTranslationText:
When	he	saw	a	fire	and	said	to	his	wife,	“Wait	- I	have	seen	a	fire	- perhaps	I	may	bring	you	an	
ember	from	it	or	find	a	way	upon	the	fire.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	 us	 ne	ek	āag	 dekhi	 to	apni	 bibi	 se	kahā	 thehro	mujhe	ek	āag	 nazar	 padi	 hai	 shāyad	maiñ	
tumhāre	liye	us	meiñ	se	koi	chingāri	lāuñ	ya	āag	par	rāsta	pāuñ.

englishTranslationText: So	when	he	came	near	the	fire,	it	was	announced,	“O	Moosa!”
romanUrduTranslationText: .Phir	jab	āag	ke	pās	āaya	nida	farmāyi	gayi	ke	aey	Mūsā!

arabicText: إِنِّىٓ أَنَا۠ رَبُّكَ فَٱخْلَعْ نَعْلَيْكَ ۖ إِنَّكَ بِٱلْوَادِ ٱلْمُقَدَّسِ طُوًۭى
englishTranslationText: “Indeed	I	am	your	Lord,	therefore	take	off	your	shoes;	indeed	you	are	in	the	holy	valley	of	Tuwa!”
romanUrduTranslationText: .Be-shak		maiñ	tera	Rab	hooñ	to	tu	apne	joote	utār	dāl	be-shak	tu	pāk	jungle	Tuwā meiñ	hai

englishTranslationText:
“And	 I	 have	 chosen	 you,	 therefore	 listen	
carefully	 to	 what	 is	 divinely	 revealed	 to	
you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	maiñ	ne	tujhe	pasand	kiya	ab	kān	laga	
kar	sun	jo	tujhe	waḥi	hoti	hai.

arabicText: إِنَّنِىٓ أَنَا ٱللَّهُ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّآ أَنَا۠ فَٱعْبُدْنِى وَأَقِمِ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ لِذِكْرِىٓ
englishTranslationText:
“Indeed	 it	 is	 Me,	 Allah - there	 is	 no	 God	
except	I	- therefore	worship	Me	and	keep	
the	 prayer	 established	 for	 My	
remembrance.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	maiñ	hi	hooñ	Allah	ke	mere	siwa	
koi	m'abood	nahiñ	to	meri	bandagi	kar	aur	
meri	yād	ke	liye	namāz	qāyim	rakh.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلسَّاعَةَ ءَاتِيَةٌ أَكَادُ أُخْفِيهَا لِتُجْزَىٰ كُلُّ نَفْسٍۭ بِمَا تَسْعَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
“The	 Last	 Day	 will	 surely	 come	 - it	 was	
close	that	I	hide	it	from	all	- in	order	that	
every	 soul	 may	 get	 the	 reward	 of	 its	
effort.”	(He revealed it to His Prophets, so 
that people may fear and get ready. The 
exact time is not revealed to the people.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Be-shak	Qayāmat	āane	wāli	 hai	 qarib	 tha	
ke	maiñ	usey		sab	se	chhupāuñ	ke	har	jān	
apni	koshish	ka	badla	pāye

arabicText: فَلَا يَصُدَّنَّكَ عَنْهَا مَن لَّا يُؤْمِنُ بِهَا وَٱتَّبَعَ هَوَىٰهُ فَتَرْدَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
“Therefore	 never	 let	 one,	 who	 does	 not	
accept	 faith	 in	 it	 and	 follows	 his	 own	
desires,	 prevent	 you	 from	 accepting	 this,	
so	then	you	become	ruined.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	hargiz	tujhe	is	ke	mānne	se	woh	bāz	na	
rakhe	 jo	 is	 par	 Imān nahiñ	 lāta	 aur	 apni	
khuwahish	ke	piche	chala	phir	to	halāk	ho	
jāye	.

englishTranslationText:
“And	 what	 is	 this	 in	 your	 right	 hand,	 O	
Moosa?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yeh	tere	dāhine	hath	meiñ	kya	hai	aey	
Mūsā!

arabicText: قَالَ هِىَ عَصَاىَ أَتَوَكَّؤُا۟ عَلَيْهَا وَأَهُشُّ بِهَا عَلَىٰ غَنَمِى وَلِىَ فِيهَا مَـَٔارِبُ أُخْرَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“This	is	my	staff;	I	support	myself	
on	 it,	 and	 I	 knock	 down	 leaves	 for	 my	
sheep	with	it,	and	there	are	other	uses	for	
me	in	it.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Árz	ki	yeh	mera	'asa	hai	meiñ	is	par	takiya	
(tek	wa	sahara)	lagāta	hooñ	aur	is	se	apni	
bakriyoñ	par	patte	jhādta	hooñ	aur	mere	is	
meiñ	aur	kām	haiñ

englishTranslationText: He	said,	“Put	it	down,	O	Moosa!
romanUrduTranslationText: .Farmāya	isey	dāl	de	aey	Mūsā

englishTranslationText:
So	 Moosa	 put	 it	 down	 - thereupon	 it	
became	a	fast	moving	serpent.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 Mūsā ne	 usey	 dāl	 diya	 to	 jabhi	 woh	
daudhta	huwa	sānp	ho	gaya.

arabicText: قَالَ خُذْهَا وَلَا تَخَفْ ۖ سَنُعِيدُهَا سِيرَتَهَا ٱلْأُولَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
He	 said,	 “Pick	 it	 up	 and	 do	 not	 fear;	 We	
shall	restore	it	to	its	former	state.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Farmāya	ise	utha	le	aur	dar	nahiñ	ab	ham	
ise	phir	pahli	ṭarah	kar	deñge.

arabicText: وَٱضْمُمْ يَدَكَ إِلَىٰ جَنَاحِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَآءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوٓءٍ ءَايَةً أُخْرَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
“And	put	your	hand	inside	your	armpit	- it	
will	come	out	shining	white,	not	due	to	any	illness	- one	more	sign.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 apna	 hāth	 apne	 bāzu	 se	 mila	 khoob	
saped	 niklega	 be	 kisi	 marz	 ke	 ek	 aur	
nishāni.

englishTranslationText: “In	order	that	We	may	show	you	Our	great	signs.”
romanUrduTranslationText: .Ke	ham	tujhe	apni	badi	badi	nishāniyāñ	dikhāyeñ

englishTranslationText: “Go	to	Firaun,	he	has	rebelled.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Fir’aun		ke	pās	jā	us	ne	sar	uthāya.

englishTranslationText: Said	Moosa,	“My	Lord,	open	up	my	breast	for	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Arz	ki	aey	mere	Rab!	Mere	liye	mera	seena	khol	de

englishTranslationText: “And make	my	task	easy	for	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	mere	liye	mera	kām	āasān	kar.

englishTranslationText: “And	untie	the	knot	of	my	tongue.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	meri	zabān	ki	girah	khol	de.

englishTranslationText: “In	order	that	they	may	understand	my	speech.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	woh	meri	bāt	samjheñ

englishTranslationText: “And	appoint	for	me	a	viceroy	from	among	my	family.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	mere	liye	mere	ghar	wāloñ	meiñ	se	ek	wazir	kar	de.

englishTranslationText: “That	is	Haroon,	my	brother.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	koun	mera	bhai	hāroon.

englishTranslationText: “Back	me	up	with	him.”
romanUrduTranslationText: .Us	se	meri	qamar	mazboot	kar.

englishTranslationText: “And	make	him	a	partner	in	my	task.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	usey	mere	kām	meiñ	sharik	kar

englishTranslationText:
“In	order	that	we	may	profusely	
proclaim	Your	Purity.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	ham	bekasrat	teri	pāki	boleñ

englishTranslationText: “And	profusely	remember	You.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	bakasrat	teri	yād	kareñ

englishTranslationText: “Indeed	You	see	us.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak		tu	hameiñ	dekh	raha	hai.

englishTranslationText:
He	 said,	 “O	 Moosa,	 you	 have	 been	
granted	your	prayer.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Farmāya	aey	Mūsā! Teri	mañg	 tujhe	
áṭa		huyi

englishTranslationText:
“And	indeed	We	 had	 bestowed	 upon	
you	a	favour	one	more	time.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	Ham	ne	tujh	par	ek	bār	
aur	ehsān	farmāya

arabicText: إِذْ أَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰٓ أُمِّكَ مَا يُوحَىٰٓ
englishTranslationText:
. “When	We	inspired	in	your	mother’s	heart	
whatever	was	to	be	inspired.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	Ham	ne	teri	mā	ko	ilhām	kiya	jo	ilhām	
karna	tha.

arabicText: أَنِ ٱقْذِفِيهِ فِى ٱلتَّابُوتِ فَٱقْذِفِيهِ فِى ٱلْيَمِّ فَلْيُلْقِهِ ٱلْيَمُّ بِٱلسَّاحِلِ يَأْخُذْهُ عَدُوٌّۭ لِّى وَعَدُوٌّۭ لَّهُۥ ۚ وَأَلْقَيْتُ عَلَيْكَ مَحَبَّةًۭ مِّنِّى وَلِتُصْنَعَ عَلَىٰ عَيْنِىٓ
englishTranslationText:
“That,	‘Put	him	into	a	chest	and	cast	it	into	
the	river,	so	the	river	shall	deposit	it	on	to	
a	shore	- therefore	one	who	is	an	enemy	to	
Me	 and	 you,	 shall	 pick	 him	 up’;	 and	 I	
bestowed	upon	you	love	 from	Myself;	and	
for	you	to	be	brought	up	in	My	sight.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ke	 is	 bachche	 ko	 sandooq	 meiñ	 rakh	 kar	
dariyā	 me	 dāl	 de	 to	 dariya	 ise	 kināre	 par	
dāle	 ke	ise	woh	 utha	le	jo	mera	 dushman	
aur	 is	 ka	 dushman	 aur	 maiñ	 ne	 tujh	 par	
apni	ṭaraf	ki	mohabbat	dāli	aur	is	liye	ke	tu	
meri	nigāh	ke	sāmne	tayyar	ho.

arabicText: إِذْ تَمْشِىٓ أُخْتُكَ فَتَقُولُ هَلْ أَدُلُّكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَن يَكْفُلُهُۥ ۖ فَرَجَعْنَـٰكَ إِلَىٰٓ أُمِّكَ كَىْ تَقَرَّ عَيْنُهَا وَلَا تَحْزَنَ ۚ وَقَتَلْتَ نَفْسًۭا فَنَجَّيْنَـٰكَ مِنَ ٱلْغَمِّ وَفَتَنَّـٰكَ فُتُونًۭا ۚ فَلَبِثْتَ سِنِينَ فِىٓ أَهْلِ مَدْيَنَ ثُمَّ جِئْتَ عَلَىٰ قَدَرٍۢ يَـٰمُوسَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
“When	your	sister	went,	 then	said,	‘Shall	 I	
show	you	the	people	who	may	nurse	him?’	
And	We	brought	you	back	to	your	mother	
in	 order	 to	 soothe	 her	 eyes	 and	 that	 she	
may	 not	 grieve;	 and	 you	 killed	 a	 man,	 so	
We	freed	you	from	sorrow,	and	tested	you	
to	 the	maximum;	you	 therefore	stayed	 for	
several	 years	 among	 the	 people	 of	
Madyan;	 then	 you	 came	 (here)	 at	 an	
appointed	time,	O	Moosa.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Teri	 bahen	 chali	 phir	 Kahā	 kya	 maiñ	
tumheñ	woh	log	bata	dooñ	jo	is	bachche	ki	
parwarish	kareñ	to	ham	tujhe	teri	māñ	ke	
pās	pher	lāye	ke	uski	āañkh	thandi	ho	aur	
gham	na	kare	aur	tune	ek	jān	ko	qatal	kiya	
to	ham	ne	tujhe	gham	se nijāt	di	aur	tujhe	
khoob	 jāñch	 liya	 to	 tu	 kai	 baras	 madyan	
wāloñ	meiñ	raha	phir	tu	ek	thehrāye	w’ade	
par	hāzir	hua	aey	Mūsā .

englishTranslationText: “And	I	created	you	especially	for	Myself.”
romanUrduTranslationText: . Aur	meiñ	ne	tujhe	khās	apne	liye	banāya

arabicText: ٱذْهَبْ أَنتَ وَأَخُوكَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِى وَلَا تَنِيَا فِى ذِكْرِى
englishTranslationText:
“You	 and	 your	 brother,	 both	 go	 with	 My	
signs,	 and	 do	 not	 slacken	 in	 My	
remembrance.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tu	aur	tera	bhai	donoñ	meri	nishāniyāñ	le	
kar	jāo	aur	meri	yād	meiñ	susti	na	karna

englishTranslationText:
“Both	 of	 you	 go	 to	 Firaun;	 he	 has	
indeed	rebelled.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Donoñ	 firaun	ke	pās	jāo	be-shak		usne	sar	
uthāya.
